532 Gallery Jaeckel
TANJA SELZER:
Afternoon, 2024
Oil on linen
40 × 30 × 3 cm
PURCHASE / INQUIRE
$3500
Shipping quote on request. Local pickup available.
About the artwork:

A serene yet charged afternoon vista incorporates theoretical contrasts, inviting reflection on first- and third-world divides through mixed-media subtlety and compelling visual dialogue.

About the artist:

Tanja Selzer’s paintings explore the boundaries of voyeuristic situations and their social consequences, confronting class issues, power dynamics, and contrasts between first- and third-world realities. Her work incorporates theoretical texts and compelling imagery, often invoking the contemporary art scene itself through mixed-media elements.

Selzer was born in 1970 in Idar-Oberstein, Germany, and lives and works in Berlin. She completed her studies at the University of Applied Sciences, Department of Design in Hamburg.

Selzer has had solo exhibitions internationally since 2005, including “Meet me in the trees” featured in a meer.com article (2014). She has participated in group exhibitions including Art Fair 21, Cologne (2008, Gesellschafter Art Award), with works in public and private collections worldwide.

View Full Artist Profile
